title: ICE: explicit failure while typechecking

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
matricks ran into this on irc.

Offending code: 

```
fn main() {
    let x = ::std::num::Float::tan(4.0);
    println!("{}", x)
}
```

Should be:

```
fn main() {
    let x = 4.0f32.tan();
    println!("{}", x)
}
```

Expecting an error message about bad usage of static method rather than ICE.

```

note: the compiler hit an unexpected failure path. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://static.rust-lang.org/doc/master/complement-bugreport.html
```
